intro: Cynoglossum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican dead nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are tubular and bilaterally symmetrical, with five petals fused at the base. Cynoglossum mexicanum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
